sub_title: Assistant Professor in Sustainable Health Systems
summary:
- Health economist, epidemiologist & modeller.
- Passionate about realistically capturing the value of interventions, policies and systems in health economic models.
- Markov cohort modelling, partitioned survival modelling, microsimulation, discrete event simulation, dynamic transmission modelling.
- HTA experience in Australia and the Netherlands. International focus.
- PhD and continued interest in the use of real-world evidence to inform funding decisions.
- Good project manager, good writer, positive person.
- Multidisciplinary background in medicine (Drs.), clinical epidemiology (MSc.), organisational anthropology (BSc.), and health economics (MSc., PhD.).
- Experience in oncology, cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, metabolic, infectious diseases, diagnostics, and emergency medicine. Current focus on the impact of centralization of emergency care.
- Experience in public health incl. research on the health impact of climate and the cost-effectiveness of nutrition policy.
